title: Large-Cap Funds Have Been Dumping Tech Stocks. Small-Cap Managers Are Overweight Them.
text:
Investment funds focused on big companies cut their holdings of tech stocks last quarter, but their small-cap counterparts took a different approach. They held on in tech and industrial shares, while hanging back on health-care stocks.

Mutual funds and hedge funds have to report their holdings to the Securities and Exchange Commission within 45 days of the end of each quarter. Lori Calvasina, head of U.S. equity strategy at RBC Capital Markets, took a look at the data, analyzing the second-quarter holdings of 394 long-only...
